item.title: [RS2E]: Player Saving and Loading to a MySQL Database
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:30, topic:225397”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=296260.msg2505599#msg2505599 date=1224899695]

Wow… i am kinda stupid when it comes to mySQL but can u use mySQL on ipbfree?

No. You don’t have access to the MySQL server with ipbfree. You MUST have the user/pass to the database the tables are on.

ok so if i get a real host and make it a .com and it uses ip boards would i then be able to?

Depends. Contact the host and make sure there is ‘Remote MySQL’, meaning you can access the mysql server from another computer (and not just localhost). By default MySQL disables this, so you may have to get them to set it up for you. But if you can get that then of course, you can.
[/quote]

ok well i am registering wit vpsland.com and making my forums in to a .com … and it has mySQL and all… but if i will check to see if its remote or local…[/quote]
If you are getting a VPS then yes, you can. Because with a VPS you have full control… So you can change anything in MySQL etc.

edit: if the server and site are hosted on the same VPS (I was assuming shared hosting and hosting on your comp), then you don’t need remote mysq.

Read full topic
item.source: [RS2E]: Player Saving and Loading to a MySQL Database

item.title: [RS2E]: Player Saving and Loading to a MySQL Database
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:28, topic:225397”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=296260.msg2505573#msg2505573 date=1224898621]

Wow… i am kinda stupid when it comes to mySQL but can u use mySQL on ipbfree?

No. You don’t have access to the MySQL server with ipbfree. You MUST have the user/pass to the database the tables are on.
[/quote]

ok so if i get a real host and make it a .com and it uses ip boards would i then be able to?[/quote]
Depends. Contact the host and make sure there is ‘Remote MySQL’, meaning you can access the mysql server from another computer (and not just localhost). By default MySQL disables this, so you may have to get them to set it up for you. But if you can get that then of course, you can.
